abstract.shortdesc: Symbian platform provides a certificate store, certstore for short, which is a repository of root and user certificates which can be retrieved and used to accomplish a variety of tasks. The certstore is initially empty. certtool is a a user-friendly eshell program for inserting certificates and manipulating their settings.
abstract.p: This document explains how to manipulate the certstore using certtool. It is of interest to anyone that needs to build, manipulate and maintain a certstore for Symbian platform. You can use certtool to do the following:

li.p: list the contents of a certificate store
manipulate application trust settings, for example, make a certain certificate trusted for use with TLS/SSL, software install, and so on.
provide support for multiple certstore implementations

conbody.p: certtool must be used from an eshell. You can start it using eshell.exe.
